website_summaries.verdict: A good all-in-one if you don’t need to print in color.
pros: Canon has focused on making it simple to print photos or documents directly from your smartphone, and that focus has paid off
cons: It only prints in black and white, and despite some incorrect product listings, it doesn’t support WiFi

customer_reviews.title: Poor support for label printing issue
customer_reviews.text: Would not print on Avery LASER labels. I put the same labels in my Brother laser and there was no ghosting or splatter. Canon support told me to go buy other labels. Thank goodness I found this defect the first week I had the printer, so I could send it back.
customer_reviews.author: W. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Office Printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a couple of weeks now. It replaced an older, clunkier Canon. The setup was relatively pain free. I've been using it connected to my network via ethernet. My PCs have had no trouble finding it as a printer or scanner. My only gripe is the auto feeder for the scanner. Documents don't come over perfectly aligned. But it's not a deal breaker at all. And as weird as it sounds, this thing is pretty. It's really black and has almost decorative etching on some of the panels. Definitely less of an eyesore than my previous white monster.
customer_reviews.author: AnonReviewer

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased enough with this product for my law office
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a beast. If you are looking for a black and white printer to handle volume in an office setting, this is your pick. I was pleased enough with this product for my law office, that I have now ordered 3 more. I will be moving the total number to 6 in the very near future. The scanning speed is also great for such an inexpensive product.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: WENT FROM INK JET TO LASER
customer_reviews.text: I don't do a lot of printing at home. My ink jet printer ink was drying up faster than I was using it. The laser printer ink is powder prior to fusing to the paper so it doesn't dry up. For me it is cheaper in the long run. This model doesn't have Wifi so you have to connect by USB or Ethernet. It's monochrome (black only) which works for me and I don't have to buy colors. Even though it prints monochrome (black) it WILL scan photos in color and format as a PDF right to my computer and name the file (img1, img2, etc). Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware Only Manual Backing of Paper
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I bought this printer for a friend. There is NO automatic backing only manual backing. Seriously, the printer has a fancy touchscreen. Manual Backing and the list price is $199? I never had a printer with manual backing; didn't know such existed in this modern age. To back the papers, the printer will print the odd numbers of the document. Then I had to reshuffle the papers so that page one is on top. Place the stack in the printer face down with the top facing the inside. Then print the even numbers. I had to convert PDF docs to Word first before printing as manual backing via Adobe Reader was impossible. Extra work, Pure frustration!
customer_reviews.author: Kitti Gal

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT a wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: You would think that since 90% of printers in this price range have wireless capabilities, and this one doesn't, there would be a huge disclaimer. Even the documentation never mentions that this model is not wireless capable. We spent a couple of hours before we figure it out. And even now, with a USB cable, it still won't print and we can't figure it out. I would not buy this printer unless you are a computer genius. It does not work as "plug-n-play."
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stuber

customer_reviews.title: The most imporatnt to know about his printer is that it does not scan to pdf.
customer_reviews.text: When scanning, despite whether it is a document or a picture, color or b&w, the only choice it gives you as to where to scan it to is BMP, TIF, PNG, JPG, JPEG formats. hence, disappointingly, the choices do not include pdf. I am still trying to find in the manual to see if I am missing something anything, but so far to no avail. I should have tested the scanner right away so as to return it before it was too late. The printer part of it good and it goes into energy saving which I like.
customer_reviews.author: MGST

customer_reviews.title: Good workhorse easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I finally made the big jump from inkjet for many year's and I had researched this one, because Canon has been reliable for me. Im so happy with this machine. For Mac I tried the enclosed disc but it wasn't loading. Went to Canon site got the proper driver and scan software, and after a few tries it loaded. I've printed out a few business documents and also scanned with it, finding that my pre loaded from other Inkjet Canon program Image Capture it uploaded the scan instantaneously . I didn't want a wireless printer, and now I know I made the right choice with this Laser Canon. It's easy, and its real super for the price.
customer_reviews.author: iloveadeal

customer_reviews.title: scanner is not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my broken Brother which lasted me 5 years and I would have been happy had they not delayed the free shipping for an entire month so I had to pay for shipping because I needed to use the printer before then. The scanner resolution is worse than the brother and this just has wired ethernet but I knew that and I am happy with the product but not the additional shipping charge from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Viet

customer_reviews.title: Melting or burning the paper to the point of putting holes in it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about a month and a half and it is putting burn/melt marks on papers to the point of putting holes in it!? I do not have a pic yet of the holes yet to submit, I threw them out because I thought that was a fluke since it stopped when I removed and reinserted the toner cartridge. The last time the problem started with the burns in the same relative places as they are now and wound up leading to holes in those same similar spots, on the right side of paper. I should have known this was too good of a deal to be true :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer fax scanner
customer_reviews.text: Sensational 5 stars for this all in one imageclass. We were so happy with our original imageclass that when my parents were showing frustration with having to keep purchasing ink cartridges for their inkjet printer/fax/scanner, I steered them towards Canon's imageclass, because our's has been such a fantastic workhorse. You see, for the cost of about 5 or so ink cartridges, they can have a lazer system instead and toner is available on amazon for $12ish. And, with toner, even if its not being used, it wont dry out like injet system. They were sold on this idea and havnt looked back. They love this because it is so much faster than the inkjet printers.
customer_reviews.author: Jai

customer_reviews.title: The nice talking lady had to delete the software and re-install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my HP 2605DN. What a difference 6 second turn on fast printing. Did have to call support as the SCAN sopped. The nice talking lady had to delete the software and re-install. I was going to try that while waiting about 1/2 hour for response. The monochrome is not a hassle most of my work is B&W. (The HP was color). The replacement black cartridge was only 16$ and still using the one that came with laser printer. Set was smooth lot of packaging places, including one buried under the carriage causing not to print. I personally very excited about this replacement laser printer after thousands of pages from the HP.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B. Guardineer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: All of my printing is one color; my last printer (also a Canon) lasted 10 years, but finally died. I started shopping for a new one, and discovered that there was such a thing as a monochrome printer. (I don't get out much) I wish I had discovered laser printer years ago. So quiet, and fast! Much cheaper to run than a ink jet. This unit was fairly easy to set up (probably easier if you read instructions) Just remember to install the software before you connect the printer to your computer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Not working very good
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of the printer, one works good and one works half good. The one I say half good is because the scan button doesn't work. I need to scan through the computer. Both printers have a problem for the Toner Cartridge. Showing I have a Counterfeit or Non-Canon Cartridge. But the Cartridge came with the machine. After awhile, an error light shows up in one of my printers, and the error indicates I have a Cartridge communication error. I am not happy with this stupid problem. Contacting Canon now, see how long it will response me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hardy Units that Hold Up
customer_reviews.text: In 2015 years ago I bought a Canon MF210, the generation before this unit. It is by far the best printer I have ever used. It prints on average of 2500 pages per month in dusty conditions with no performance malfunctions to date. The Canon 137 cartridge is long-lasting and reasonably priced. The image quality for the scanner is good, and the network setup is no problems. It was a no-brainer for me to purchase the updated unit when it was time to add a second printer. I recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain ManTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: All in one machine
customer_reviews.text: This item performs all the functions that I needed copying, scanning and faxing. It is a bit pricey but I would rather pay the higher price on the machine then the ink cartridges as you will need to replace them more often than the printer. It was easy to assemble with a Plug and play into the computer. Paper is easy to load on the front and the item comes very well packaged to protect the item.
customer_reviews.author: Adams Adams

customer_reviews.title: Very fast over USB not so over Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: The printer and scanner is crazy fast when run through USB. Not so fast when run over Ethernet. Pages that took 6 seconds to scan from the printer to computer over USB took a minute or more over my 1 GBps network that's painfully slow. So I mainly use it over USB and I'm very happy. I still love the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Rstar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works as promised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works as promised. Replacing my ancient LaserJet was an exercise in frustration. First an HP that wouldn’t connect via USB, then a Canon that falsely advertised mobile printing. When the third package arrived, I expected another set of problems. But this budget Canon performed beautifully. I had it printing from both my HP laptop and iPhone in less than ten minutes. Print output is crisp and clear, and faster than I expected. Can’t exaggerate how pleased I was with the purchase. Only one minor complaint. The LCD display is hard to read—you have to lean down and really focus. That said, once you finish the set-up, you really don’t need to look at it again.
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Super fast
customer_reviews.text: I am required to use laser printers in my business and I purchased this to replace my old work horse HP 4050 (which was getting harder and harder to find parts for). I was expecting a slow tonor guzzling printer. In all actuality, it is better than my 4050 and super fast. Only warning, the interior is a great machine, but tjhe exterior is a bit cheap. Use care with moving exterior parts. They feel like they can break easily.
customer_reviews.author: NettieR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ALL IN ONE product
customer_reviews.text: My husband works from home and we need to have everything in the Home Office running as smooth as possible. We love Canon brand, same which we had before. So we decided it was time to replace it. We bought this ALL-IN-ONE printer for our needs. It works fast and easy. The installation process and setup of the product was no brainer. Easy instructions in the box are very well explained. The product came with its own ink. Will recommend this product to anyone who works from home.
customer_reviews.author: O. Mori

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy for a fast printing B&W - Copy, Print, Scan
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer if you have to print high quality B&W quickly. As advertised this printer prints quick & clear black & white. Feeder is easy to use for copies and scans. The scan utility could be more robust & I wish it would do double-sided (even if I had to flip the pages). Toner cartridges will not break the bank... Good buy in any case (I do not use the fax capability)
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Fracalossi

customer_reviews.title: Buy toner once a year.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this printer the 1st time on an Amazon Black Friday deal. We loved it. This is our 2nd one in 6 years. The first one we paid $80 for and it came with one thing of toner. We have only purchased toner once. It was a trio pack for less than $30. I still have one unopened. This doesn't print color or have wifi built in. However, for my home this is the way to go. Anything else we can print off at the library or shutterfly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Erin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great little all in one!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connected it up and installed the software. My linux box picked it up immediately. Top load pulls the pages a bit crooked sometimes, but scans right to the computer, makes good copies. It goes to sleep so it saves money. All in all I like it. I also connected up to it with the android apps easily. Works great for home use. I don't do tons of printing, but when I do it is ready. I wish it had wifi, but for the money I paid I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Very highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is great! Great price! Amazing copies! However, the setup was a little more complicated than other printer/copiers we’ve had. Called the Tech support and they helped solve my problems very quickly. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: POL

customer_reviews.title: Canon MF236n lives up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: The good - ease of use, print speed, multi-function, much less expensive printer cartridges (using LxTek cartridges). and excellent tech support walking me thru the set-up. The bad - manual is not very well done and I would have had a lot of trouble setting this up myself using the manual. This printer replaced a very old HP printer which actually had a phone attached to it! The HP printer had been acting up and finally died (thankfully). The rating for print quality is only a 4 star since I have not yet had to replace the initial starter cartridge. The starter cartridge print quality is OK but could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Max L. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Its kinda big - be forewarned, I set it up using a network connection so anyone at home can print. easy installation, unit uses a print cartridge ( not inkjet silliness). Click print on word/pdf and the document spits out in 1/2 second, prints multiple pages so fast you cant take them out quick enough if you wanted a very good value for money - be sure to order a new cartrige as the one that comes with it wont last long as its a tester/teaser one
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod Beeblebrox

customer_reviews.title: Love how everything works.
customer_reviews.text: My last laser printer lasted twelve years, it still works, but not as well. I thought that I was ordering a color printer when I ordered this printer. I found that with the new u.s.b. 3.0 and above, you have to look for the u.s.b. 2.0 connection on your computer and laptop. Most of the U.S.B. ports are now 3. and above my laptop has only one 2.0 port. I enjoy the coping as well as the scanner capability, if I had a phone line I would be glad to use the fax. But so far I'm enjoying this printer and don't have any complaints at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Don Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: So-so, so far.
customer_reviews.text: I knew this was going to be tough installing all four major features. Installed the copying and printing function fairly quickly. The fax installation at least so far, requires three PhDs. No soap so far. Can't figure how to scan. I need help but I've called tech support twice so far and each time a robot told me there was a 30 min wait and another time, 40 minutes. I'll keep trying and hopefully if it does what it says, I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A Turner

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Printer for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer. It produces black and white copies that are clear and legible. It is, however, bulky and heavy. The set up took some time and might be difficult for some. After the set up, the printer works very well. It does not have Bluetooth capability, but I did not purchase it for that feature. Overall, a very good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Canon imageCLASS MF236n
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good printer. I should have read the specs better though. I'm used to my hp that connects wirelessly. Although you can use mobile printing apps with this, you still need to have it plugged into a router. Not a huge issue, but I probably would have spent a little more to avoid having to now go buy a router. Overall, the prints are good quality and just what I needed when I'm making a lot of prints for Girl Scouts.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool printer for home office
customer_reviews.text: My initial impression is that it is pretty cool. I bought it to use for my home office. Do not need to use it to much. Hoping to get a couple years out of it. Came with a toner inside. Bought an extra toner. I like the print quality. Not the best but defo better than my old inkjet. If anything major happens ill update the review. Until then it is awesome and I got a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Fetti F Peet

customer_reviews.title: By far the worst printer Ive ever used
customer_reviews.text: By far the worst printer Ive ever used. Even when Ive gone through tech support there is no fixing the issue of why I have to turn the printer on and off every time I have to print something. I suppose I got what I paid for. Save your money for something more efficient and next time Ill be sure to spend a little more on getting a wireless printer. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Carina Gggggg

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, great value, smaller footprint (a good thing) than originally imagined
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on a Wednesday, and it arrived on Sunday, yes, Sunday, on a holiday weekend (Memorial Weekend). I opted for the free shipping as the printer was not mission critical. So, bonus! This is a nice, multi-function laser (toner, NOT ink) black/white printer. This model is not wireless, but hooks easily to a wireless router so it functions decently enough "wirelessly" for my needs. My home eco-system is all Apple products, and this Canon plays very well with Apple. The downloadable manual is 715 pages, well laid out, and has clear instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Jweilan

customer_reviews.title: AirPrint works great! Don’t read the bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of idiots on here don’t understand how AirPrint works. AirPrint works great when printer is connected to router via Ethernet cable. This printer isn’t wireless but I don’t care since it’s right next to the router anyway. Printer is fast and responsive even when it’s asleep from wireless computers across the house. Fingers crossed this continues. Top feeder jammed the first time I used it. I wonder if that’s a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B

customer_reviews.title: Lack of cables and no usb port.
customer_reviews.text: Does not have even one usb port for connectivity. the packaging does not include any wiring other than a power cord and telephone cable. No ethernet and no usb to printer cable. So you have to buy the cables or configure everything wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great all-in-one from Canon
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing an old Canon imageClass and this was the perfect choice. I love the quiet feature so that I'm not distracted while working with loud printing sounds. It's very easy to use and very classy looking! Anything I scan comes through with no distortion, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow it really prints quickly
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer. I was disappointed that it wasn't wifi and I had to use a usb to connect. I should have gotten the wifi that was on the next level. If I do buy the canon again I will make sure it has wifi. I was really surprised how fast it printed. I use lexmart at work and this printer is faster and cartridges are so much cheaper. If you don't need to do color copies, Canon is the one to go for. Recommended by my techie son who has had it for a while and says it never jams- Love it-
customer_reviews.author: BZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in home office printer
customer_reviews.text: Have used this printer for years now, everyone in the house uses it. We copy, scan and print. Always does a great job. Plus, we are still on the original toner cartridge. Highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: BornForTech

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for home office
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to work from home during the COVID-19 pandemic. The only drawback was that I cannot figure out how to or if it is even possible to print a fax confirmation or transmission confirmation page. I have read the manual both online and what was provided with the printer and gone through all of the settings on the printer. If anyone has any ideas on how to do this or if it is possible with this model, please share with me. Other than that, it was a super easy setup and has been very simple and convenient. Perfect for what I needed it for...note, I print a lot and fax a lot of correspondence in my job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died after little use in 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought oct.2017 . It’s now July 2018 and it won’t turn on . I bought this to print off receipts for work related items for reimbursement. In 10 months I’ve printed off maybe 20 pages and now I have a huge paper weight . Says my tech support expired on dec 2017. Totally disappointed at Canon
customer_reviews.author: Dalen F. Snow II

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement. No AirPrint.
customer_reviews.text: This product states that it has Apple AirPrint. It does NOT. It even states it on the box, however it does not even talk about it in the manual. As a cheap copier it comes in handy but that is where it ends. No Wi-Fi/Bluetooth connectivity either, which I was okay with since it was advertised as having Apple AirPrint capability. I would have returned it but I needed to copy a bunch of stuff immediately so I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Nasekos

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is not a wireless printer. It requires to be plugged into the modem or computer. The actual printing quality is pretty good. The instructions are a little hard to follow. Took a little bit longer than expected to get to work. Would probably purchase I wireless printer next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: Unreal price
customer_reviews.text: After repeated headache with my inkjet printer, I decided to pick up this monochrome laser printer. The last time I bought a printer was almost 10 years ago and I was utterly stunned to find the build/tech quality of this printer. It is unbelievable how much $130 printer gets you now days. This all-in-one is serious overkill for my occasional document print in my home office. I thought I was getting an entry level printer but barring image quality, toner capacity and speed, this little thing can do everything our enterprise level office printer can. My mind is blown away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unable to connect it
customer_reviews.text: It did not come with a USB cable despite that being the only way to connect it to the computer. The cable that connects to the router does absolutely nothing and it is extremely difficult to reach technical support to fix this and get my printer running. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Arnoldo Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Nice set up and laser the only way to go with monochrome ,when black print is all you need.
customer_reviews.text: Still have a few things to figure out with this printer but overall it suits my needs. Prints pretty darn fast , I can barley get over to the printer and all the printing is done. It took a little bit to get the software to boot up but kept at till they both signaled to each other. Would buy again and would recommend again as this laser printer has barely used any cartridge toner yet and I've printed minimum fifty pages.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Sandez

customer_reviews.title: No Wireless Support; Can’t Support Apple AirPrint
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon description says the printer supports Apple AirPrint. But Apple support says, “If your printer is AirPrint-enabled for printing from your Mac or iOS device, just make sure that it's connected to the same Wi-Fi network used by the Mac or iOS device.” Guess what? The MF236n does not support wireless connection. And to make matters worse, there was no USB cable in the box to connect directly to the computer. So I am returning the printer, having wasted a lot of time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Gilliland

customer_reviews.title: Bs
customer_reviews.text: Why does it say mobile ready and all that when it doesn't even included the cables you need to hook it up? What a joke. I'm livid.
customer_reviews.author: Britny Flores

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, simple printer/scanner/fax/copier that is great for home office use. Set up is quick and painless, and aftermarket toner is relatively inexpensive. All in all a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: paper feed
customer_reviews.text: i've tried everything i can think of, but when i put i want one page two come out, when i want 2 copies for copies come out, two ae what i want and two are blank, when i place the two blanks back in it does the same thing when i don't put them back in i still get one blank for one print im wasting a lot of paper
customer_reviews.author: manny

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Read The Fine Print
customer_reviews.text: Really fast printing with good quality. BEWARE, this is NOT wireless, wish I would have read that disclaimer before buying. You CANNOT print in the go!!! So disappointed & it does not print 2-sided...ugh! Would NOT but again. It does print fast & fair quality, but READ THE FINE PRINT!
customer_reviews.author: Rainey Addington

customer_reviews.title: How to get the serial No.?
customer_reviews.text: How to get the serial No.? ... switch STATUS MONITOR/ DEVICE INFORMATION/ SERIAL NO./ it shows on screen. Product works for window 10... Original and genetic toner both can work. The cable line, connecting the printer and computer, is not provided. Print b&w only, but rough and tough.
customer_reviews.author: HUEYWEN CHU

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: Works well but you have to have a wifi connection in order to use it with a phone. I don't have internet at home so I can't print from my phone. There isn't a cable that I can attach my phone to it either. The copier part works great and lasts along time.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 5

customer_reviews.title: How many pages you can print with a toner
customer_reviews.text: Only for home. Copies, faxes, etc. I have had one the same brand bought 10y ago and was still working when for my mistake some paper inserted not well get jammed and was impossible to me clean out. Trying desperately I broke something inside ! I was very angry bec as use the Canon was still.perfect for my few home necessities. In fact I bought the same one ! Lol Very recommended !
customer_reviews.author: Magdalena Savarino

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With This Printer
customer_reviews.text: After two years of nothing but hassles with Epson inkjet, I finally ordered this laser printer. YES it is black only ink (that's what I wanted) and not wireless (I didn't want wireless). It works great. Very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This printer is awful
customer_reviews.text: This had been the worst experience with a printer I have ever had. I have mine hard wired so it should be pretty fast.. it’s not. It sometimes takes 20 minutes or more for it to even start printing. I get a screen that says sending to printer and it starts so late I want to throw this machine. Also I’d you change your paper size and don’t specify every time on the machine as well as your print settings it will not print. Save yourself the hassle and buy a brother
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Biernacki

customer_reviews.title: Good for Home Use
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an earlier Canon printer/scanner/copier/fax. The scans are much faster. The paper loads very strangely, but so far I have not had any jams (my old printer was starting to jam frequently). It is more compact than the old one. I have not used the wireless feature as next to my computer turns out to be the best location for it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery and amazing the difference in speed of printing pages compared to my regular ink printer. Super happy with this purchase. Ive always like canon pribters hut made a mistake this last time buying a hp so glad im back to canon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't include everything it claims should be included!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer because I love Canon printers. I opened the box and noticed there is no USB cord included as stated. I contact the seller and was told I would have to purchase the USB cord myself because they do not include it through Amazon. I will not purchase from the seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The software for this printer would not download to my ...
customer_reviews.text: The software for this printer would not download to my computer - neither from the included CD nor from Canon's web site. I know how to install the software, I just kept getting an error message half way through the process. I have a one year old Dell laptop running Windows 10. I could only give it one star because I couldn't get it to run with my computer at all. I returned it and am looking at other printers.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: Very large and bulky
customer_reviews.text: Nice printer but is it very large and bulky. i have had it for a couple of months and it was very easy to set up and is very easy to use. the only reason i gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is it is just too big. there are other printers that do most of what this does that are smaller. It had the dimensions listed but it just seems big.
customer_reviews.author: Holly in GA

customer_reviews.title: It covers all my needs in printing and scanning mostly
customer_reviews.text: I really love this machine. It covers all my needs. Only problem I saw is that I can not print both sides of the paper. I have to go one side first and then flip page to print other side
customer_reviews.author: FP

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on Mac!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work on Mac at all! Not supported on OS 10.13 and up! Canon site says it is but it is not. I just bought this last year and it just stopped working. Apple can't help. Now I'm out $300.
customer_reviews.author: Stock Dizzle

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for home office
customer_reviews.text: Great small office or home office printer /all in one great price easy set up , connect it to your home network via Ethernet cable and you can print from your phone . Recommend have bought 2 so far one for my home one for my dads home office . Scanner works great and so does the copier
customer_reviews.author: PIGPEN211

customer_reviews.title: Good, but does not do WiFi Printing
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly bought this, not knowing it didn't do wifi printing. It also didn't come with a USB cable, which was a little puzzling. Otherwise, the test page I copied was stellar.
customer_reviews.author: Chris King

customer_reviews.title: Even with great tech support could not remove back to get to ...
customer_reviews.text: Ink supply inexpensive Difficult removal of jamed paper from print roller. Even with great tech support could not remove back to get to the paper
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WIFI PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: Setting up wi fi not really as simple as they make it sound. I connected my printer usu=ing a usb cable.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Solow

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Are you also tired of the ink clogging ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Are you also tired of the ink clogging on inkjet printers? This fixes that problem. There are non-brand replacement cartridges with good reviews I've used successfully available on amazon also.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Different

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have bought 5 of these for my stores, easy to use, easy to maintain, ink lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Tech help useless
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Should have gotten wireless on first order. Couldn’t get AirPrint to work. Waited for an hour for Canon tech and no answer. Packed it up and sent back. Bought the 264dw. See review
customer_reviews.author: R. Mesnick

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer/scanner/copier
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many printers and scanners. This one is awesome. Zero complaints. Works great. It also doesn't have a chip in the ink, so I can buy my ink from LD and save a lot of money. I plugged this into my wifi router at home and now any device connected to wifi can print! Very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this printer! My husband put it on Wi-Fi and i can print wirelessly from any device: phone, iPad, laptop. I have also faxed several times with it. Works flawlessly. I can't do without this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria W Wong

customer_reviews.title: Not mobile ready
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this printer for 2 reason, I was looking for remote print like from phones or computers. It reads in the directions mobile ready IT IS NOT. Had to return to amazon for refund and purchase another cannon hopefully this will work wirelessly. This printer was for school and projects. We have used it some and it prints great and no jams just not wirelessly like we needed
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT

customer_reviews.title: Great Canon printer
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Inexpensive and does a great job. However, I didn't realize it doesn't do double-sided printing. LOVE the fact that, if you ever have a question or problem and call Canon, you actually speak to a person you can understand with no accent.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: It is proving more difficult than I originally thought. ...
customer_reviews.text: It is proving more difficult than I originally thought. I have to set up mobile printing and wireless printing with the help of someone because instructions weren't clear and I've had the machine since last year.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Olowu

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have wifi connect, I made and assuption and missed that in the descript so I returned it for one that did but a good stand alone or network printer as long as it's hardwired.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Source of all evil
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried everything I can think of and so far it’s just a giant copy machine .... can’t connect to any of our computers can’t use blue tooth or WiFi can’t scan can’t print in color ugh
customer_reviews.author: nick nelson

customer_reviews.title: Not wireless and you can't print out of box without accessories not included
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wireless, all in one printer. This came up on my list, had good reviews. Turns out it isn't wireless at all. And worse, it doesn't come with a printer connection cable. So they send you something that won't work out of the box. Pretty awful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pain in the bum!
customer_reviews.text: To scan.... several steps to accomplish. Honestly put a page in to copy, started and went to the restroom.... when I came back it was STILL thinking! This machine makes me cranky! I only kept it in my office for 3 weeks! Gave it away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Horrible printer! Do not waste your money on this. It was such a pain to use everytime we needed it. Had to be plugged in to work, no wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Familyof5

customer_reviews.title: great product when you get it set up.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, Instructions are terrible, you can't set it up with tiny pictures, even a magniifing glass you can't get it set up.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P. Argenta

customer_reviews.title: Prints well but forget WiFi capability
customer_reviews.text: This prints very well. Had to go to the store and get a cable to hard wire it to my computer. Cannot for the life of us figure out how to WiFi print. As long as I am printing from my computer it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: Ras birds

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to replace an older Canon all in one that was not compatible with Windows 10. The owners manual is very long and it took a while to work through some of the set up and instructions. So far, this machine works very well. It did an excellent job of printing some waterproof labels without any smudging or ghosting.
customer_reviews.author: Dun Runnin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great printer easy to setup and fast response from click of print
customer_reviews.author: Michael Frizzle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, working great thus far with every wireless device.
customer_reviews.author: B. Snook

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up and prints quickly and clearly. Haven't used it enough to write a thorough review. Will repost at some point. Great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J Pursell

customer_reviews.title: NOT A COLOR PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: IT'S FINE. GIGANTIC BUT FINE. Prints fast and clear. Large ink tray. Lousy paper catching tray. Really flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Grh1

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful asset to my classroom
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I am a classroom teacher and having the ability to print quality documents at a high quantity is key.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased without reading details but ended up making it work. I am very happy with it. No WiFi but plugged into a range extender. Doesn’t do duplex. I like the airdrop feature.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Small

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY SCANS AND PRINTS
customer_reviews.text: I bought the system for the scan capabilities. The digital output is very low quality. The quality of the print is also terrible. I just started using the scanner more and am very disappointed. Don't buy this for quality. Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.author: Maz

customer_reviews.title: Have never been able to get the wireless printing to ...
customer_reviews.text: Have never been able to get the wireless printing to work which is disappointing as it was one of the reasons I chose it.
customer_reviews.author: Lad87nek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is the newer model of the printer I have used for several years now. Absolutely perfect. No hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small copier in my classroom for last minute copy jobs. It works very well and quick! Unfortauntly, I can’t speak for any of the other things it can (fax, print from computer, etc). But as a copy machine, it’s wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Katie0010

customer_reviews.title: Solid Better than HP
customer_reviews.text: We had a problem with newish HP so went with good old reliable Canon. Perfection.
customer_reviews.author: orrink

customer_reviews.title: Good printers for small office
customer_reviews.text: Good laser printers best price was on amazon. It does the job and cartridge price isn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best printer/scanner on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best printer/scanner on the market. I use one in my home office and one in my work office and have even recommended it to my clients.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Bowles

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've had this a couple years now. I print mostly coloring pages for the kids and do a lot of copying. I just bought replacement cartridges, and they were only about $10.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Auto feeder is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. The auto feed on both the top document feeder & the regular paper feed are very poorly functioning, causing things to print & copy off center. Additionally it was a nightmare to try to hook up with computer. I’ve really like canon products in the past but I would not purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Does all the things you want it to do. Crisp printing. Can copy and scan. I don't need to use the fax. Very helpful. Love it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AbdurRehman Syed

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Only used it a few times, still new to me. I will keep you updated =)
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Angel

customer_reviews.title: Good print quslity
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to set up print from my iPhone. But I have to connect printer to router. I bought the wrong one I wanted wireless. It worked out excellent anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

product_meta.title: Canon ImageCLASS MF236n All in One, Mobile Ready Printer, Black
feature_bullets: All in one functionality allows you to print, scan, copy and fax.
Print at speeds of up to 24 pages per minute.
Print on-the-go with Canon PRINT Business, Apple AirPrint, Morea Print Service, and Google Cloud Print.
Low energy consumption; uses 2 W or less in energy saver mode.
